rename.from: Strange stack trace because reused exception code is defined as val
rename.to: Invalid stack trace because reused exception code is defined as val

issue.title: fix #23416 instantiate exceptions at right time

labels.name: tested
labels.description: PR that was successfully built and tested by Jenkins

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body: fix #23416 instantiate exceptions at right time

body: The stack trace will always look the same so I guess it was intentional. We could add `NoStackTrace` instead to remove the stack trace completely, though we should also improve the error message to be more descriptive of what has happened.

I'm having this being thrown and am trying to debug what is going on, since the cause might be in the implementation of the reading/writing done by a different lib the stack trace would be more than welcome. Currently the trace points to the location where .run() is called which is very confusing.

```
java.io.IOException: Reactive stream is terminated, no writes are possible
	at akka.stream.impl.io.OutputStreamAdapter.<init>(OutputStreamSourceStage.scala:164)
	at akka.stream.impl.io.OutputStreamSourceStage.createLogicAndMaterializedValue(OutputStreamSourceStage.scala:151)
	at akka.stream.impl.GraphStageIsland.materializeAtomic(PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.scala:627)
	at akka.stream.impl.PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.materialize(PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.scala:458)
	at akka.stream.impl.PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.materialize(PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.scala:420)
	at akka.stream.impl.PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.materialize(PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.scala:415)
	at akka.stream.scaladsl.RunnableGraph.run(Flow.scala:439)
	at my.project.ImportExport$.readZip(ImportExport.scala:66)
...
```

where the line in my code is this

```scala
val is = source.toMat(StreamConverters.asInputStream(5.seconds))(Keep.right).run()
// the reading of the InputStream is handled further down in the code using a Future
```

The error is probably caused by the library I am using that writes to the stream and closes/flushes multiple times.

Also this is the only place in Akka streams where I see this pattern of pre-creating the exception. Sure this is not an accidental mistake?

@jrudolph There are 3 places where this is thrown so the stack trace would not be the same after the fix. As I see it, it would point to the code writing to the stream which is exactly how this would need to be debugged.

> There are 3 places where this is thrown so the stack trace would not be the same after the fix.

I see, that might be a good reason to keep the stack trace. Another possibility would be to create three different exceptions. Note, though, that in no case, the stack trace would point to user code. It now points to `materialize`, with `def` it will later only contain infrastructure code, starting from the thread pool, through streams infrastructure to the GraphStage.

@jrudolph let me prove the usefulness of the real trace

created an example main class __akka.stream.Main__
```scala
package akka.stream

import akka.actor.ActorSystem
import akka.stream.javadsl.StreamConverters
import akka.stream.scaladsl.{ Keep, Source }
import akka.util.ByteString

import scala.concurrent.Future
import scala.concurrent.duration._
import scala.util._
import scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext.Implicits.global

object Main extends App {

  implicit val system = ActorSystem()
  implicit val mat = ActorMaterializer()

  val source = Source.repeat(ByteString("foobar"))

  val is = source.toMat(StreamConverters.asInputStream(5.seconds))(Keep.right).run()

  Future {
    is.close()
    is.read() // bug outside of akka streams
  }.onComplete {
    case Success(_) ⇒
      println("ok")
      mat.shutdown()
      system.terminate()
    case Failure(e) ⇒
      e.printStackTrace()
      mat.shutdown()
      system.terminate()
  }

}
```

running this before my patch:
```
java.io.IOException: Reactive stream is terminated, no reads are possible
	at akka.stream.impl.io.InputStreamAdapter.<init>(InputStreamSinkStage.scala:117)
	at akka.stream.impl.io.InputStreamSinkStage.createLogicAndMaterializedValue(InputStreamSinkStage.scala:100)
	at akka.stream.impl.GraphStageIsland.materializeAtomic(PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.scala:627)
	at akka.stream.impl.PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.materialize(PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.scala:458)
	at akka.stream.impl.PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.materialize(PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.scala:420)
	at akka.stream.impl.PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.materialize(PhasedFusingActorMaterializer.scala:415)
	at akka.stream.scaladsl.RunnableGraph.run(Flow.scala:496)
	at akka.stream.Main$.delayedEndpoint$akka$stream$Main$1(Main.scala:20)
	at akka.stream.Main$delayedInit$body.apply(Main.scala:13)
	at scala.Function0$class.apply$mcV$sp(Function0.scala:34)
	at scala.runtime.AbstractFunction0.apply$mcV$sp(AbstractFunction0.scala:12)
	at scala.App$$anonfun$main$1.apply(App.scala:76)
	at scala.App$$anonfun$main$1.apply(App.scala:76)
	at scala.collection.immutable.List.foreach(List.scala:392)
	at scala.collection.generic.TraversableForwarder$class.foreach(TraversableForwarder.scala:35)
	at scala.App$class.main(App.scala:76)
	at akka.stream.Main$.main(Main.scala:13) <-- ???
	at akka.stream.Main.main(Main.scala)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at sbt.Run.invokeMain(Run.scala:67)
	at sbt.Run.run0(Run.scala:61)
	at sbt.Run.sbt$Run$$execute$1(Run.scala:51)
	at sbt.Run$$anonfun$run$1.apply$mcV$sp(Run.scala:55)
	at sbt.Run$$anonfun$run$1.apply(Run.scala:55)
	at sbt.Run$$anonfun$run$1.apply(Run.scala:55)
	at sbt.Logger$$anon$4.apply(Logger.scala:84)
	at sbt.TrapExit$App.run(TrapExit.scala:248)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
```

and with my patch applied

```
java.io.IOException: Reactive stream is terminated, no reads are possible
	at akka.stream.impl.io.InputStreamAdapter.subscriberClosedException(InputStreamSinkStage.scala:117)
	at akka.stream.impl.io.InputStreamAdapter.executeIfNotClosed(InputStreamSinkStage.scala:125)
	at akka.stream.impl.io.InputStreamAdapter.read(InputStreamSinkStage.scala:144)
	at akka.stream.impl.io.InputStreamAdapter.read(InputStreamSinkStage.scala:130)
	at akka.stream.Main$$anonfun$1.apply$mcI$sp(Main.scala:24) <-- \o/
	at akka.stream.Main$$anonfun$1.apply(Main.scala:22)
	at akka.stream.Main$$anonfun$1.apply(Main.scala:22)
	at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.liftedTree1$1(Future.scala:24)
	at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.run(Future.scala:24)
	at scala.concurrent.impl.ExecutionContextImpl$AdaptedForkJoinTask.exec(ExecutionContextImpl.scala:121)
	at scala.concurrent.forkjoin.ForkJoinTask.doExec(ForkJoinTask.java:260)
	at scala.concurrent.forkjoin.ForkJoinPool$WorkQueue.runTask(ForkJoinPool.java:1339)
	at scala.concurrent.forkjoin.ForkJoinPool.runWorker(ForkJoinPool.java:1979)
	at scala.concurrent.forkjoin.ForkJoinWorkerThread.run(ForkJoinWorkerThread.java:107)
```

you can clearly see the second trace pointing to line `24` which is the invalid `is.read()` causing the exception where before the trace pointed to line `13` which calls the `.run()`

issue.title: Backport changes from Streams 2.5.5

repository.name: akka.net
repository.description: Canonical actor model implementation for .NET with local + distributed actors in C# and F#.

issue.body:
## 2.4.16 (19.11.2016 - 20.12.2016)

- [x] - [fix SourceQueue docs inconsistencies](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21877)
- [x] - [Fixed the case when identity flow appended to Source combining materialized values](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21956)
- [x] - [less noisy logging of idle-timeout (for akka-http specifically](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21989)
- [x] - [asOutput stream close race](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21896)
- [x] - [InputStream from StreamConverters.asInputStream respects read() contract](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21954)
- [x] - [Fix handling of escape sequences in JsonObjectParser](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21975)
- [x] - [add note on (non)guarantees of materializer SPI](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21935)
- [x] - [Lazy source](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21081)
- [x] - [Tree flattening should be separate from Fusing](https://github.com/kkasravi/akka/commit/73ed75a66967ca3692b9ed86775d7d81b54feb4e)
- [x] - [Fixed the bug in Attributes.getFirst(default : T)](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21846)

## 2.4.17 (21.12.2016 - 10.02.2016)
- [x] [add Java API for NegotiateNewSession](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22280)
- [x] [fix typo in GraphStage port validations](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22062)

## 2.4.18
- [x] [fixed corruption of ordering in MergePreferred caused by using emit](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22569)
- [x] [Fail all stages on abrupt termination](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22809)
- [x] [Truncated contents in existing files for FileIO.toPath/toFile](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22807)
- [x] [Make viaMat on identity Flow preserve upstreams/downstreams](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22649)
- [x] [ClassCastException in SubSink](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22567)
- [x] [Fail framing for negative frame sizes](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22562)
~- [Failed: CompressionIntegrationSpec](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22557)~ Artery spec
- [x] [GroupedWithin cold emit fix](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22555)
- [x] [rewrite Source.empty to GraphStage](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22479)
- [x] [Fix invalid ranges in ByteStringSpec](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22392)
~~[Close Java Stream after completion](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22307)~~ Only relevant for Java
~~[fix FileIO parameter type to OpenOptions](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22770)~~ Only relevant for JVM

those three are ported in #2737
- [Don't leak sub flows when mat fails](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22647)
- [Add startPosition option for FileIO API](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22657)
- [Lazy sink wait for init](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22033)
